When I am in any NNTP Newsgroup, I can use 'N','T' or ' ' for next (unread) message. However typically to start my "read everythign from top to bottom" session I click in the (bold) newsserver name in the unified folder view. With that node selected (message pane shows "Thunderbird News") the next message functions in the navigation menu are disabled and the hotkeys do not work.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. click on news server folder
2. press 'N'
3.
Actual Results:  
nothing happens

Expected Results:  
Go to first unread message in first newsgroup with unread messages

comments.raw_text:
Bernd, is it your opinion that it worked differently in version 2?

(In reply to comment #1)
> If you change the folder view to all folders does it work then ?

ludo I think unified is a red herring. tested as follows ... if I click on a news server *account* (I think that's what reporter means by "news server folder") and do N it does nothing in BOTH All Folders view and Unified view.


If that is not what is meant then I am misinterpreting the steps or the steps are incomplete (the numbered steps should list all items needed for *someone else* to reproduce the issue, such that if any one step is removed the reproduction fails)


more generally, in unified view 
a) if I am in a collapsed unified group (eg. templates) and there are no unread messages and do N, then it wants to take me to the first account shown in unified Inbox
b) if I am in a specific account within any expanded unified group with no unread messages and I do N, then it wants to take me to the next folder *in that account*, as if I were not in unified view
